org.domainobject.animation.sp.arrayobject

Class Pos4Color4Texture

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.domainobject.animation.sp.arrayobject.ArrayObject
      • org.domainobject.animation.sp.arrayobject.Vertex
        • org.domainobject.animation.sp.arrayobject.Pos4Color4Texture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    _Pos3, _Pos4

    public final class Pos4Color4Texture
extends Vertex
implements _Pos4
    An 10-component vertex class suitable for specifying a position (first four slots) a color (next four slots) and two texture coordinates (last two slots).
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

      • allocate

        public static NonIndexedMemory<Pos4Color4Texture> allocate(int maxNumObjects)

      • init

        public void init()
        Initialize this instance. The x, y and z coordinates are set to 0, as are the red, green and blue channels. The w coordinate is set to Vertex.globalW and the alpha channel is set to Vertex.globalAlpha. Note that until you call this method or one of the other setters, the internal state of a new instance is undefined, both in theory and in practice!
